review_title: Positive experience overall, but definite room for improvement.
pros: The faculty, staff and especially students here are great. The benefits are phenomenal, especially the PTO and retirement. Normal business hours are cushy. Midtown is a beautiful area to work in and you feel like you're part of something special. Gorgeous offices.
cons: The upper administration is a bit rigid and straight-laced. Annoyingly asinine policies such as dress code are enforced for staff. While I was there, the microwave in our building was removed because an executive-level staffer couldn't stand the smell of certain foods. Thanks a lot. There are not a lot of fun events or college-sponsored team building for staff: no official holiday party, no summer picnic, etc. You may expect that an art & design college would be a super fun environment to work in, but for administrative staff this is not so much the case. It's still a hard and fast place of business that expects a lot of its employees, and possibly includes a good amount of weekend work depending on your role.

review_title: Great place to work overall with some challenges
pros:
-Great benefits: retirement contribution whether you match it or not, paid winter break, lots of PTO days and 13 paid holidays
-Good work/life balance
-Excellent educational environment
-Talented students and faculty
-Beautiful campus
-Opportunity for advancement (to an extent--usually people stay in the same department but they promote based on seniority within a department instead of hiring outside people)
cons:
-Technologically, the company could improve.  Everything is still on paper instead of digital (they are just now starting to transition) which is surprising for a top design school.  The software/email system used is inefficient and archaic on the administrative side.
-There are not enough employee outings or company gatherings.  CCS does not sponsor a holiday party anymore and there are no faculty/staff picnic or retreat/teambuilding activities.  The offices are all very separate. Thus, the departments don't always work well together.
-The pay is not great, as CCS is a private insitution.
-There are no bonus opportunities and raises are irregular.

review_title: CCS is a community of talented academics and professionals committed to excellence in design education.
pros: Working at CCS means that you are surrounded by talent, both that of faculty and students. It's a great place to take advantage of attending some of the amazing lecture events they set up with high-profile art and design professionals, and it can be a lot of fun to attend student exhibitions or even just to tour the hallways during the semester when students are hard at work. Benefits including time off was very fair.
cons: As with any university or college, certain systems or policies can be slow to change or adapt. It can be hard to know who to talk to about getting something done when there are many departments and not a lot of transparency around who does what, but this can often by handled by attending staff meetings and making a point to get to know the staff in other departments.

pros: At least when I was there, we were pretty much left alone to do whatever we were pleased to do as long as we "do our job". Most of your time working as a work study is spent waiting for the next customer, so you are essentially paid to do your homework.
